definition: lightning/electricity/electric (bound form)/to get (or give) an electric shock/phone call or telegram etc/to send via telephone or telegram etc

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Emoney is no longer just a matter of geeks playing games.
sentences.chinese: 电子货币不再只是几个电脑狂人玩游戏了。

sentences.english: Now that’s e currency I’m interested in.
sentences.chinese: 现在我所感兴趣的是电子货币。

sentences.english: Anonymous e-money works just like real paper cash.
sentences.chinese: 无记名电子货币根一般的纸钞是一样的。

sentences.english: It is going to be ane-currency exchange.
sentences.chinese: 这将是一个电子货币交换。

sentences.english: A national electronic-money system would operate as a debit-card system.
sentences.chinese: 一个全国性的电子货币系统如同结算卡系统那样运行。

sentences.english: Identified e-money contains information revealing the identity of the person who originally withdrew the money from the bank.
sentences.chinese: 记名电子货币包含着从银行里取款人的身份。

sentences.english: Digital cash is one example of digital currency.
sentences.chinese: 数字现金是电子货币的一种形式。

sentences.english: I need a functioning e-currency exchange website.
sentences.chinese: 我需要一个有效的电子货币交换的网站。

sentences.english: At least, that's what participants at this year's Digital Money Forum believe.
sentences.chinese: 至少，今年电子货币论坛的参与者们是这么认为的。

sentences.english: They would issue e-money for, say, a1 percent surcharge.
sentences.chinese: 他们发行电子货币获取，比如说，1%的额外费用。

sentences.english: Together with its higher velocity, continuous electronic money can approach near instantaneity .
sentences.chinese: 流通速度越高，连续电子货币就接近即时支付。

sentences.english: In general, e-money should be characterized as a substitute for currency .
sentences.chinese: 一般的，电子货币具有流通货币的替代品的特征。

sentences.english: We need a functioning e-currency exchange website.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个有效的电子货币交换的网站。

sentences.english: Logo is for online e-currency exchanger.
sentences.chinese: 标志是网上电子货币交换。

sentences.english: What I'm talking about is electronic currency.

definition: token (used instead of money for slot machines, in game arcades etc)
Fabi, first currency issued by the 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3] in 1935, in use until 1948
Central Bank of the Republic of China (Taiwan)
